thread.title: Car Sales, Jobs Report, Earnings Are Highlights This Week
thread.title_full: Car Sales, Jobs Report, Earnings Are Highlights This Week

title: Car Sales, Jobs Report, Earnings Are Highlights This Week
text:
Car Sales, Jobs Report, Earnings Are Highlights This Week Written by: Kurumi Fukushima 08/02/15 - 12:15 PM EDT Tickers in this article: AGN AIG CBS CVS DIS F FCAU FIT FOXA GM JD PCLN TSLA TWX WWAV 
NEW YORK (TheStreet) -- U.S. car sales, the July employment situation report, key earnings reports and economic data are all expected highlights on Wall Street for the week of Aug. 3. 
Automakers gear up to report their sales figures Monday. Fiat Chrysler releases its sales first at 8:30 a.m. ET, followed by Ford and General Motors . Industrywide auto sales are expected to be strong again for the month of July. GM's volume is likely to come in lighter after the company reduced sales to rental-car companies .The jobs report is due Friday. Wall Street will be watching the unemployment number, which TheStreet's Jim Cramer says is the most important figure that moves the market. The labor department is expected to report employers added more than 200,000 jobs in July, keeping the jobless rate unchanged at the seven-year low of 5.3%. Other notable companies reporting quarterly earnings include American International Group , CVS Health
